answers.answer: Such rashes can occur with regular insulin, Lantus® and others.  You should mention this to your mother’s family doctor.  If he continues to insist that the rash is due to bacteria on the skin, you might want to request a second opinion, from either a dermatologist or a doctor who specializes in treating diabetes.

question: My 87 year old mother has developed a rash over all parts of her body. These itch and will bleed when she scratches them. They are getting progressively worse. Her family medical doctor has said it is due to bacteria on her skin. She has been treated with triamcinolone and he has reduced her Effexor thinking that is a likely cause. I was wondering however if Lantus could be the culprit since this seems to have gotten worse since she was switched to that.
title: ALLERGY TO LANTUS?
